DataElement.preferredName: G-8 Screening Tool F Body Mass Index Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response indicating the BMI level or range.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: G-8 Screening Tool Body Mass Index Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tool for the assessment of geriatric cancer patients. It combines 7 questions from the mini nutritional assessment (MNA) with one question regarding subject age. Items selected from MNA concern nutritional status, weight loss, body mass index, motor skills, psychological status, number of medications, and self-perception of health._One of the anthropometric measures of body mass; it has the highest correlation with skinfold thickness or body density._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tool for the assessment of geriatric cancer patients. It combines 7 questions from the mini nutritional assessment (MNA) with one question regarding subject age. Items selected from MNA concern nutritional status, weight loss, body mass index, motor skills, psychological status, number of medications, and self-perception of health.

Items selected from MNA concern nutritional status, weight loss, body mass index, motor skills, psychological status, number of medications, and self-perception of health.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of the anthropometric measures of body mass; it has the highest correlation with skinfold thickness or body density.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: An individual's weight in kilograms divided by the square of the height in meters.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Rave study NRG-HN004 - smt 9/12/17

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a body mass index measurement less than 19.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a body mass index measurement greater than or equal to 19 but below 21.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.origin: G-8:Geriatric 8 Screening Tool, C.A. Bellera, et al. Annals of Oncology 23: 2166-2172, 2012
